image.altText: a man's silhouette

props.synopsis: He decided tough, decisive and quick action was needed.

title.children: After his son was bullied, this father took out a personal protection order against the teenage perpetrator

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: A psychologist tells the ACT Supreme Court a 30-year-old Canberra woman who recruited a hit man on the dark web to kill her parents did it because she was sexually abused as a young child.

title.children: Court hears Canberra woman recruited hit man on dark web to kill parents due to abuse she suffered as a child

image.altText: A smashed up blue car after a fatal accident.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard "excessive speed, inexperience [and] intoxication" were just some of the factors that likely contributed to the fatal crash that killed a 21-year-old Canberra man in 2022.

title.children: Man who died in Canberra crash was unlicensed and affected by alcohol, inquest hears

image.altText: A man and a woman hold hands and smile at each other while outdoors walking

props.synopsis: While Canberra is one of the least-religious states and territories in the country, for those who adhere to a faith, it's the most important thing in their lives. So what does that look like?

title.children: Meet the faithful — what does religion look like in Canberra?

image.altText: Damage from a fire in a prison common space.

props.synopsis: A man has been spared more jail time over his role in a 2020 riot at Canberra's jail, which started after prison staff refused to serve dessert or hand out cigarettes.

title.children: Man spared more jail time over Canberra prison riot which caused $1.6 million in damage

image.altText: A firefighter at a grassfire in Pialligo near the ACT and NSW border.

props.synopsis: While the Bureau of Meteorology is predicting an "average" fire season for the Canberra region, the biggest risk is expected to come from storms and grass fires.

title.children: As the weather starts to heat up in Canberra, what can you do to prepare for fires and storms?

image.altText: A woman stands in front of microphones, with a man behind her looking at her.

props.synopsis: Many observers believed the Canberra Liberals leadership tussle was a two-way contest. But just like Scott Morrison in 2018, it was a third player who emerged victorious.

title.children: Like Scott Morrison in 2018, few saw this new opposition leader coming

image.altText: Two alstation dogs

props.synopsis: A retired senior constable opens up about the special relationship that exists between police dogs and their handlers following the tragic deaths of two canines.

title.children: NSW Police implement immediate changes after 'devastating' deaths of two service dogs

image.altText: A composite image of five people, four men and a woman. Their faces are in boxes.

props.synopsis: One by one, these insiders left the world's biggest social media companies, troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people.

title.children: These insiders and whistleblowers are troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: Chris Henggeler is the only grazier in Australia using feral donkeys to regenerate his remote property. Now he's on the wrong side of the law.

title.children: Meet the grazier going feral in a groundbreaking 'illegal' experiment to regenerate his land

image.altText: A child is immunised via droplets into the mouth in a clinic.

props.synopsis: Israel's military denies responsibility for the strike, which occurred during a pause in fighting. UNICEF has described the incident as "disturbing".

title.children: Four children injured in drone strike on Gaza polio vaccination centre

image.altText: Vice President Kamala Harris and Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese toast

props.synopsis: The US is Australia's most important military ally, one of our biggest trading partners and a critical diplomatic partner in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: What the US election result might mean for Australia

image.altText: Donald Trump puts his finger in an aircraft shelter

props.synopsis: Donald Trump, for all his sins, has proved himself to be an astute politician with an unerring ability to dominate the news cycle and garner attention. As he would see it, all publicity, no matter how awful, really is good publicity.

title.children: Trump could win the election, despite his long rap sheet. His 1997 book holds clues for how he works

image.altText: Man seen from mouth down sitting with crossed legs with lap-top in lap. He wears shirt and jeans, and has ginger beard.

props.synopsis: Unprecedented legal battles are testing if parent companies of tools like ChatGPT can be liable for defamation when innocent people are incorrectly described as criminals.

title.children: When AI wrongly described this man as a criminal, it thrust him into uncharted legal territory

image.altText: A man casts his vote into a mobile ballot box in his living room.

props.synopsis: A national security adviser to the country's president says a Russian-backed oligarch has sought to buy votes to swing the results of an election.

title.children: Moldovan government accuses Russia of 'massive interference' in presidential election

image.altText: A modestly dressed king walks down the high street of a Spanish village with body guards and a crowd surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Residents scream "get out" as King Felipe VI and other officials tour one of the worst-hit areas of flood-ravaged Valencia City.

title.children: Spanish king and queen pelted with mud as locals vent anger over government's flooding response

image.altText: A jockey urges his horse to the line in the Melbourne Cup as another horse runs on in the background.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Cup has changed greatly in 30 years, but some things remain the same. Just ask three-time cup-winning jockey Kerrin McEvoy.

title.children: How to win the Melbourne Cup and how this has changed

image.altText: A police officer standing with weapons around his belt, his back to the camera and an earpiece in his ear.

props.synopsis: A gangland shooting and brawl that involved dozens of people on Friday has sparked anger and promises for change in France.

title.children: 'Web of corruption': Why a deadly 60-person brawl could spark a French crackdown on drug trafficking

image.altText: Woman driving van with dog next to her

props.synopsis: Lesley Larkin's family feels like time is running out to catch her killer as the 40th anniversary of her violent Noosa death approaches.

title.children: Who killed Lesley Larkin? Family's desperate push to solve one of Australia's most baffling cold cases

image.altText: A man stands on his citrus farm and holds a glass of orange juice.

props.synopsis: There's a good reason the price of orange juice has risen and supermarkets are not to blame.

title.children: Orange juice price-hike hard on shoppers' pockets but good news for Aussie farmers

image.altText: Marathon participants run under the Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: The milestone follows a three-year candidacy period and a record-breaking Sydney Marathon a few weeks ago where 25,000 runners participated.

title.children: Sydney Marathon to join elite ranks of world marathon majors alongside London and New York City

image.altText: People walking past a Westpac sign.

props.synopsis: A solid finish to a bumpy week on Wall Street has the ASX poised to rise today at the start of the banks' mini reporting season. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise ahead of US election and RBA decision, Westpac profit falls 3pc

image.altText: A man sitting at a park bench

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's south-east are calling for better signage to discourage people from feeding feral birds.

title.children: 'It's gotten much worse': Chris enjoys eating outdoors, but not with the bird droppings on benches

image.altText: A young man looks at his smartphone.

props.synopsis: A web of 'delusional' regulatory decisions has essentially turned some perfectly good phones into e-waste.

title.children: Customers suddenly find their new phones can't make calls or send texts

image.altText: Sejr Deans in a hospital gown lies in a hospital bed and holds up two fingers while friends pose for a photo around him.

props.synopsis: After being the first player signed to the Tasmania JackJumpers, Sejr Deans went on to represent Australia and then later moved to the US to follow his dream. But a year into a contract, he suffered a cardiac arrest.

title.children: Sejr was the JackJumpers' first-ever signing, but a cardiac arrest nearly ended his basketball dream

image.altText: A purple lightning strike fills the sky.

props.synopsis: Victorian authorities brace for difficult fire conditions with high temperatures and storms with dry lightning forecast this week.

title.children: Dry thunderstorms could spark hundreds of fires in Victoria this week, weather bureau warns

image.altText: Max Verstappen driving his F1 car in the rain at the Interlagos circuit in Brazil

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has one hand on what would be a fourth Formula 1 drivers' championship, coming from 17th to complete one of the great victories.

title.children: Max Verstappen puts one hand on world title with historic win from 17th, Norris's title hopes on life support

image.altText: Godzilla_(1954)

props.synopsis: Godzilla may have had the odd face lift and seen some major technological advancements over its 70 years, but no-one in showbiz works harder than this apex predator.

title.children: Happy 70th birthday, Godzilla: Tourism ambassador, Oscar winner and metaphor for environmental dread

image.altText: A group of women wearing work shirts and protective boots.

props.synopsis: Women working in male-dominated industries are proving anything's possible when given the chance, and it could help ease Australia's ongoing skills shortage.

title.children: Women taking on male-dominated industries prove anything's possible given the chance

image.altText: Brown and white apartment block on left side, with aerial view of car park with a few cars and trees.

props.synopsis: The Inner West Council has a plan to turn four of its council car parks into 200 affordable homes for essential workers. Experts say there is a desperate need for homes to house key workers who can't afford to live where they work but such projects are not a quick fix.

title.children: 'A real solution to the housing crisis': Council car parks in Sydney to become affordable housing

image.altText: Several people seen swimming and relaxing at the beach, seen from far away

props.synopsis: If Australia doesn't have a population plan, how will it meet the challenges of coming decades?

title.children: Australia is clearly bad at managing population growth and it's time for a plan

image.altText: A rider dressed in black attempts to hit a bike with a yellow L plate a two other riders ride beside the pair.

props.synopsis: Dashcam footage shows bikies surrounding the L-plater, with one hitting and kicking out at the rider.

title.children: Police allege a Mongols bikie tried to punch and kick a learner rider on Melbourne freeway

image.altText: An elderly Indigenous man wearing a suit looks at the camera

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal Northern Territory politician says he believes racism is worsening in Darwin after he was asked to show identification before refuelling a rental car at a service station.

title.children: Aboriginal politician calls out racism after he was asked to show ID at service station

image.altText: 100-year-old photo of a man dressed in striped prison uniform.

props.synopsis: Photographer Pete Smith has recreated an image of carnival performer Hanco 100 years after the original was taken by his grandfather. He hopes it will draw out the escape artist's descendants.

title.children: Historic photo recreated in quest to solve mystery of Australian Houdini's final disappearing act
